column1: Sue is so nervous for her finals.

column3: One day Samantha's tire blew while she was driving.
column4: She was able to properly change her tire.
column5: Samantha was very grateful to be able to get home safely.

column1: Linda loved to bake for her family.
column2: She made some cookies that her kids loved.
column3: They gobbled them up as soon as they got home from school.
column4: Linda looked at the empty plate in disbelief.
column5: She would have to make more tomorrow.

column1: Rico was forbidden to have a girlfriend until finished school.
column2: But he already have a girlfriend for a year.
column3: He hide it from her parents.
column4: When his parents find out they told rico to break up with her.
column5: But rico did not do it because he loves his girlfriend that much.

column1: It was a Friday, and I began to walk to work.
column2: As I neared the entrance, I saw a twenty dollar bill on the ground.
column3: I stopped to pick it up, but wondered if there might be more around.
column4: I checked in the street nearby, and found another twenty!
column5: Satisfied, I went into work, $40 richer than I was before I left.

column1: Carole went into work on Monday, thinking it was just another day.
column2: She sat at her computer for an hour before her boss called her over.
column3: Her boss explained that Carole's job was cut due to budget issues.
column4: Carole went back to her desk to clear her things, stunned.
column5: She walked to her car, shaky, but grateful for unemployment.

column1: Amy unexpectedly found out she was pregnant.
column2: At first she was not excited and was very nervous.
column3: As time went on, she became very excited to have a baby.
column4: She couldn't wait for the baby to be born.
column5: When the baby was finally born, she was overjoyed to be a mom.

column1: Cindy has an empty fridge.
column2: She decides to go grocery shopping.
column3: She picks out turkey, vegetables and cheese.
column4: She drives herself home.
column5: Cindy enjoys a healthy, homemade dinner.

column1: Kim was in the middle of baking cookies one day.
column2: When she went to get the butter there was no more left.
column3: Kim had never met her neighbors before but walked next door anyway.
column4: The neighbor was very nice and gave Kim some butter.
column5: Kim was able to complete her cookie-baking.

column1: Craig was an actor in a local theater group.
column2: He really wanted to be a play writer, however.

column4: He showed it to the theater's director.
column5: The director liked it so much, he agreed to put the play on.

column1: After years of waiting, Jason finally got a dog named Jake.

column3: For the next decade and a half, the two were inseparable.
column4: Jake got very sick and Jason had to put him down.
column5: Just as he had done when saying hello, Jason cried saying goodbye.

column1: Carl woke up one morning and thought the world was blurry.

column5: The owner had to replace everything when he noticed.

column1: My wife bought a bag of frozen chicken and pasta last week.

column3: It was very convenient.
column4: The bag said its contents served four.
column5: It barely fed the two of us.

column1: Polly bought a house in the country with a barn and several acres.
column2: A feral cat lived in the barn and had the job of catching mice.
column3: Polly fell in love with the cat and gradually tamed it.
column4: Years later, the cat has become as friendly as Polly's house cats.
column5: It still prefers to live in the barn, however.

column1: Allen was at the mall with his friends.

column3: All of sudden a girl with blonde hair and ripped jeans stepped out.
column4: Allen fell in love instantly as she walked past.
column5: He was so starstruck he couldn't even say hi as she walked away.

column1: Tom had enough of Tammy stalking him.

column3: As his landlord, she had the keys to his apartment.
column4: Tammy in his bathroom while he showered was the final straw.
column5: He went down to the court and took out a restraining order on her.

column1: There was a large festival in front of my school.
column2: Many people hung out, took pictures and ate food.
column3: A large thunderstorm occurred around the school.
column4: Everyone got soaked.
column5: However, it didn't stop them from having a good time.

column1: Sandy liked to jump rope.
column2: She used it wherever she went.
column3: One day she was jumping rope when her brother zoomed by on his bike.
column4: Her rope caught the handle of his bike.
column5: Her brother got a new jump rope that day.

column1: John's car had broke down.
column2: John made use of the warranty.
column3: John did not realize it would cost a lot to fix the car.
column4: John realized the price of the fix was similar to a new car.
column5: John bought a different car from a different brand.

column1: I retired from my job in 2012.

column3: I went to my transit authority to apply for a performer's permit.
column4: I wanted to sit on at a station with a cane and solicit donations.
column5: The transit authority refused to give me a permit.

column1: Anna wanted sugar in her coffee.
column2: Anna looked in the pantry.
column3: She took out a bag of sugar.
column4: She poured sugar into her coffee.
column5: She stirred in the sugar with a teaspoon.

column1: Amber was excited for her upcoming high school prom
column2: However she did not have a boy to go with, she was sad
column3: She knew a boy named Robert who also had nobody to go with
column4: She was shy, but approached Robert anyway about going
column5: Robert said yes, and they had a merry time

column1: Ralph was very hungry one morning.

column4: He decided he would make waffles.
column5: After a bit of preparation, he was able to cook his meal.

column1: Tom was on his way to work.

column3: He accidentally locked the door on the way out.
column4: Tom was locked out of his apartment and car.
column5: It took him minutes to get back in.

column1: The bathroom cleaner waited until I got out of the bathroom.
column2: She tried to talk to me in spanish.
column3: Since I didn't understand what she was saying, I couldn't reply.
column4: She became mad and started to yell at me.
column5: I simply walked away.

column1: Louis was running for class president.
column2: He made a lot of posters.
column3: Louis put the posters up around school.
column4: Louis delivered a good speech to his classmates.
column5: He was voted class president.

column1: Tane overslept and missed his school bus.
column2: He hoped his mom was still home to drive him to school.
column3: But she had already left for work, so his stepdad drove him.
column4: The whole ride to school, Tane had to listen to a long lecture.

column1: I met a great guy at the dog park.

column4: He then suggested that we go to dinner.
column5: We ate at a great sushi restaurant that allowed dogs.

column1: A party was about to happen.
column2: Doug wanted to make a treat.
column3: He looked online for a treat.
column4: He found a good recipe.
column5: He made Chex Mix.

column1: Lea was used to feeling high and mighty because her father was rich.
column2: Fancy clothes and expensive gadgets always made her feel important.
column3: She was angry when the star at ballet school was a poor girl.
column4: With holes in her tights, Ann was so talented, everyone admired her.
column5: Lea had to grudgingly admit there are valuable things money can't buy.

column1: Barry was making last minute preparations before his big trip abroad.
column2: He checked his bags again as well as his wallet.
column3: He made sure his phone was charged.
column4: This trip was supposed to be fun but he felt somewhat nervous.
column5: The irony made him smile -- and then made him feel better.

column1: Ian loved playing sports.
column2: But he hated letting down others.
column3: After he joined his school's soccer team, he was afraid of messing up.
column4: During an important game, he failed to block the goal.
column5: Overridden with guilt, he decided to not play anymore team sports.

column1: Iva wanted to buy a dog.

column3: Then she decided to do a good deed by adopting a shelter dog.
column4: Iva went to the shelter and picked out a new dog.
column5: She was so glad she had rescued a great dog for her pet!

column1: Ben had to cram information for an exam tomorrow.

column3: Around 5 am, he started to get dressed for school.
column4: When he arrived, he walked carelessly to class.
column5: He kept falling asleep during the test since he didn't sleep well.

column3: I was so sad I would never see my friends again.
column4: Luckily, I was able to find new friends pretty quickly!
column5: Moving across the country was not so bad after all!

column1: Jane was on vacation.
column2: The room she booked had water damage.
column3: Her reservation had to be cancelled at the last minute.
column4: All nearby hotels were booked.
column5: Jane wound up having to stay slightly out of town.

column1: My sister in law was upset today.
column2: She tried to use her Friendly's gift card.
column3: They said she had no balance on the card.
column4: I asked her if she had two cards.
column5: She suddenly remembered she had a second card in her purse.

column1: Hank drove to town every Sunday to restock his pantry.

column3: He crashed through a farm fence and ran into a haystack.
column4: Hank fell in love with a widow who lived there who came to his aid.
column5: They were eventually married in the same field as the accident.

column1: Bill came upon a corral of horses.

column3: He purchased one and name it Muffin.
column4: Muffin came to live on Bill's farm.
column5: Muffin taught bill how to cherish friends again.

column1: Sloan spontaneously bought a new camera.

column3: He decided he would make one about frozen food.
column4: He spent an hour filming his freezer and an hour filming his oven.
column5: The documentary was a huge failure but Sloan felt satisfied with it.

column1: Lou liked to feed stray animals.

column3: The cat kept coming back on a daily basis.
column4: Lou decided to take the cat in as his pet.
column5: The cat has been Lou's best companion since.

column1: Leo was a student who loved science.
column2: He decided to enter the science fair.
column3: He performed his experiments and painstakingly recorded the results.
column4: The day of the science fair came, and the judges were very impressed.
column5: His hard work paid off.

column1: My son survived a tornado.

column3: The tornado brought heavy rains and thunderstorms.
column4: The wind and lightning did a lot of damage.
column5: He is still afraid of thunder.

column1: Tom and Jane met in math class.
column2: They hit it off splendidly.
column3: They dated for years, even through college.
column4: Tom proposed after five years.
column5: Tom was going to marry Jane.

column1: Jeff was storing things in his attic.
column2: He noticed a nest of spiders in the attic.
column3: Jeff went to the store and bought some insect spray.
column4: He returned to the attic.
column5: Jeff sprayed the spiders with the spray.

column1: Barbara was cooking dinner for her husband.
column2: He came home and lit a cigarette and got out the newspaper.
column3: Barbara set the food down in front of him.
column4: He didn't even thank her.
column5: Barbara decided she was going to get a job outside of the house.

column1: There once was a man named Tim.
column2: Tim was caught doing crimes and got locked up.
column3: He spent every minute of every day planning escape.
column4: Eventually he discovered a way out and took it.
column5: He lived a happy life after he got out.

column1: Dan wanted to ask Kara to go with him to Prom.

column4: Dan and five friends went and sang a song under Kara's window.
column5: Kara told Dan she'd love to go the prom with him!

column1: One day, Matt's dog was sick.
column2: He had to take him to the vet.
column3: Once he got there, he filled out a lot of paperwork and waited.
column4: Eventually, the vet saw his dog and prescribed some medicine.
column5: Thankfully, the dog got better soon!

column1: My friend and I were walking.

column3: My friend slipped on a patch of ice.
column4: He yelled a scream of pain.
column5: He had broken his ankle.

column1: Bill ran a bookshop with his partner, Sam.

column3: Bill had some gambling debt so he secretly stole from the register.

column5: Bill's mistake was when he got too brazen and took everything.

column1: Tom was playing basketball with his friends and there was an audience.

column3: Tom took his watch off and set it under the hoop.
column4: Someone stole Tom's watch.
column5: Tom never wore a watch again.

column5: Frustrated, Juliet bought two frozen pizzas instead.

column1: Nicole loved to write by an oil lamp at night.

column5: But when everything was ready, she could enjoy a nice light.

column1: Willy had always wanted to come here.

column1: Hannah began dating a boy named Nick from school.

column1: The author had a scheduled book signing at the library.

column1: Gina loved all kinds of fruit.

column1: Sal is always cold.

column5: Sal's house was warm again.

column5: Charles told human resources and they fired Mat.

column1: Amanda wanted to become a actress.

column4: The teachers talked to him.

column1: Eloise has been opening the pet store for over a year.

column1: Bob went downtown to see the concert in his town.

column4: He wrote down the names of the bands to remember them.

column1: Suzy and her pals played in snow drifts during recess.

column5: Suzy and her pals found themselves alone under a darkening sky.

column1: Ben slept throughout the entire afternoon.

column1: Drew had a spelling test on Friday.

column1: Once a month Bonnie went to the church hall with her grandmother.

column1: Nancy loved her cats.

column3: She gave them uncomfortable clothes to wear.
column4: And she fed them whatever she ate.
column5: Eventually, her cats developed diabetes and died at early ages.

column4: He ask them to call him if the man had even the slightest trouble.
column5: Then they found out the patient was a famous malpractice attorney.

column1: Kelly couldn't wait to go on a trip to Italy.

column3: When she got there however she got sick.
column4: She had to lay in bed a long time.
column5: The trip wasn't good after all.

column1: I once felt like doing something romantic in a random way.

column4: I strolled up and gave her the rose.
column5: Just then a huge guy appeared, asking what I said to his girlfriend.

column1: Jill's family moved to a new town.

column4: It was her best friend, Milo.
column5: She was so happy that she gave him a huge hug.

column1: Samia fell in love her coworker.

column3: One day Samia got a call from a woman she didn't know.
column4: The mystery woman was the mother of her boyfriend's five kids.
column5: Samia was devastated because he told her that he had no children.

column2: All of a sudden, his dog pulled on the leash.
column3: Timothy fell, and the dog ran away.
column4: Timothy looked for the next hour for his dog.
column5: He finally found him humping a woman's leg.

column1: My sister  wanted  to  become  a dentist.

column3: Now her children  are  older  and  more  independent.
column4: My sister  takes  classes at the local  community  college.
column5: She is back on the   path  to  dental  school.

column1: Jim needed to take a shower.

column4: And he rushed to school.
column5: That day, everyone avoided Jim.

column5: A kind family had decided to adopt him!

column1: The woman tried to tie a turban.

column3: Her friend helped her tie it.
column4: It fell of her head again.
column5: She took off the turban.

column3: His final fight was tonight against the champion.
column4: He punched and kicked at the champion, but twisted his foot.
column5: He lost the match and had to go to the doctors.

column1: Mandy loves to cook.
column2: She often tries different meals from recipes she reads about.
column3: One day she decided to try baking.
column4: She discovered she was very good at it.
column5: Mandy now bakes for a living.

column1: Sara had to carry her groceries home.

column3: She traced her steps outside.
column4: Luckily, she found the cheese down the road.
column5: She picked it up and brought it home.

column1: Skip was out on a date with his girlfriend.

column3: His girlfriend went through his phone.
column4: She threw water in his face as he returned.
column5: Skip was dumped for cheating on his girlfriend.

column1: LInda was out with friends.
column2: She wore a lot of make up.
column3: It started to rain.
column4: All of Linda's make up started to run.
column5: She had to clean herself off in a bathroom.

column1: Janice had never volunteered at her daughter's school.

column3: On the way, I ran over a turtle and it crashed my bike.
column4: I landed on my head and it cracked my helmet.
column5: The helmet was split in two but my life was spared that day.

column1: Alyssa plays soccer.
column2: She an excellent goal keeper.
column3: Today Alyssa Injured her knee.
column4: She went to the emergency room.
column5: Her injury will prevent her from finishing the season.

column1: My mother liked to cook smoked turkey for Thanksgiving.
column2: She worked very hard on the turkey.
column3: One year, she left the turkey on the table to rest and my dog got it.
column4: He pulled it down to the floor, and we had no turkey to eat.
column5: Luckily, we still had plenty of side dishes to eat for Thanksgiving.

column1: Matt wanted a sandwich.
column2: While making it he noticed that the bread was a little bit moldy.
column3: He decided to go ahead and eat it anyway.
column4: Later, he became sick from the mold.
column5: He learned his lesson to never eat even slightly moldy food again.

column1: I went to a new nightclub ready for some fun.
column2: The parking was 20 dollars.
column3: When I went inside, the bouncer asked for a 40 dollar cover.
column4: I spent the entire night staring at my empty wallet.
column5: I went home and decided to never go back again.

column1: Steven was in need of money for a suit for the school prom.
column2: But Steven's family did not have money.
column3: So Steven started mowing lawns on the weekends.
column4: Steven raised enough money for a nice suit.
column5: Steven had a great time and was named the Prom king.

column1: Leah got kicked out of her house.

column3: Leah packed up all her clothes and things.
column4: She brought her things to Kim's house.
column5: Leah stayed at Kim's until she found an apartment.

column1: I was waiting in front of the bathroom for my friend.
column2: A dragonfly suddenly flew near me.
column3: It tapped the side of my face.
column4: In an attempt to get away from it, I can.
column5: My friend tried to look for me.

column1: Billy's mom told him to go outside and play.
column2: He knew he was not allowed to play with the fireworks.
column3: Because they were illegal within his city limits, the police came.
column4: Billy's mom got a $300 ticket.
column5: Billy was in big trouble.

column1: I was knocking on doors for my job.
column2: I experimented with leaving right away.
column3: Once a man asked me why.
column4: I noticed he held a pistol.
column5: I was uncomfortable with his street.

column1: In 2013 a paint bar opened down the street from our home.
column2: People were invited to paint and drink.
column3: This place could not get a liquor license.
column4: They offered non alcoholic drinks.
column5: The store failed in 2015.

column1: I had lots of imaginary friends when I was little.
column2: I didn't think anything of it, but they stayed for a long time.
column3: I realized I still depended on them in my adulthood.
column4: I talked to a therapist about this phenomenon.

column1: A lot of things were supposed to happen today at my house.

column3: The run down shed was supposed to be removed at my landlord's expense.
column4: My husband and I agreed that I should stay home to take care of these.
column5: Not surprisingly, no one ever showed up.

column1: Charles was 10-years-old when his uncle took him skiing.

column3: Charles began sliding backwards down a slope.
column4: He skied faster and faster, knocking people down in his path.
column5: A guard stopped Charles and then said he must be a professional.

column1: Jane had been working a lot lately.

column5: Jane was very pleased.

column1: Hunter just turned thirty and his body started to hurt.

column3: The doctor recommended Hunter try yoga.
column4: Hunter signed up for yoga classes at his gym.
column5: A week after doing yoga every day and Hunter felt five years younger.

column1: Sara has a big English test tomorrow.
column2: She has not studied at all.
column3: Her test counts for half her grade.
column4: Sara decided to pull an all- nighter.
column5: When she got to school, she slept through her test.

column1: Tom invested a lot of money in a company.

column4: Unfortunately it was at a low point.
column5: Tom lost a lot of money.

column1: I wanted the little blue dress.

column4: I put it back on the rack and walked away.
column5: I returned and bought it the next day.

column1: Bob had a tiny 20 inch TV.

column4: He bought a 60 inch plasma on black friday.

column5: He realized that the salad was a few weeks old.

column1: Tara had a lot of homework to do.

column1: I grew up hating dogs.

column5: Larry's friends stopped talking to him.

column1: On Saturday our family watches baseball games.
column2: We park by the stadium.
column3: Order snacks.
column4: We sit in the bleachers near home plate.
column5: The game starts and we watch all 9 innings.

column1: The girl scouts were having a special ceremony.
column2: It was for new girl scouts!
column3: They lit candles and walked across a bridge.
column4: It was a special day for the girls.
column5: They loved being part of a troop.

column1: Tom entered a big race.
column2: He never worked out for it.
column3: The day of the race Tom knew he couldn't do it.
column4: Tom decided to take shortcuts and cheat.
column5: He was disqualified.

column1: At night the campers could hear the wolves howl in the distance.
column2: One night the campers thought the wolves sounded closer to the camp.
column3: They started to feel like they were being watched.
column4: The wolf hunting party came out of the shadows staring at the campers.
column5: The wolves looked at the terrified campers and walked away.

column1: Kimi wanted a new fridge.
column2: Her landlord told her it was not necessary.
column3: He bought a raffle ticket for a new fridge at a charity event.
column4: Her number was picked as the winner.
column5: She got a new fridge despite her landlord.

column1: Linda was lying on the couch watching TV when the phone rang.
column2: When she got up to answer it she tripped over the dog and fell down.
column3: It wasn't funny at all but her brother Sam started laughing at her.
column4: As Linda got up off the floor she threw a pillow at Sam.
column5: Before he could throw it back Linda ran out of the room laughing.

column1: Yesterday during my lunch break I went to get tacos.
column2: I drove for 20 minutes to get some tacos.
column3: They took too long to make the tacos, so I had to take them to work.
column4: It took so long that I was late getting back to work.
column5: My boss was mad at me for being so late.

column1: Lance said he would clean the living room.
column2: He got too tired to vacuum.
column3: Eventually the carpet kept getting dirtier.
column4: It was obvious he hadn't cleaned it.
column5: His parents wound up grounding Lance for a weekend.

column1: Stanley was typing up a report for work.
column2: It was a long report and the deadline was close.
column3: Before he finished, his computer froze and crashed.
column4: Stanley panicked and thought he lost his work.
column5: Fortunately, Stanley backed up his work on a USB drive.

column1: Graham decided to make pancakes one morning.
column2: He mixed up some pancake batter in a bowl.
column3: Then he poured the batter onto a hot griddle.
column4: He spent a few minutes flipping pancakes.
column5: When they were finished he at them with syrup and butter.

column1: When I was a boy I wanted to dance, but my dad wanted no part in it.
column2: He was a man's man, loved football and only wanted that for me.
column3: I played football, but I danced in secret at night.
column4: One day, my dad saw me dancing and he cried; I thought he was mad.
column5: But he wasn't mad, he was simply happy that I was happy dancing!

column1: The first time I got on an airplane I was so scared.
column2: The flight attendant saw that I was nervous.
column3: Once everyone was in their seats she came over to me.
column4: She asked if I needed anything to make me more comfortable.
column5: I immediately felt better knowing she was there to help.

column1: Lucy and her grandparents ate dinner.
column2: Lucy ate all her fries and got more.
column3: She wanted more but grandma stopped her.
column4: Lucy had to eat her hamburger first.
column5: She ate it quickly and grabbed the last of the fries.

column1: I got a call from a friend yesterday.
column2: In my excitement I dropped my phone on the ground.
column3: It made a loud crack.
column4: The screen broke on it.
column5: It still works but looks terrible.

column1: Tom's house had an old well.
column2: They tried to cover it up.
column3: Unfortunately one day it rained a lot.
column4: The well partially collapsed.
column5: Tom had to get it professionally filled.

column1: Bethany is four years old.
column2: She asked her mother where her brother came from.
column3: Her mother told her a story about a stork.
column4: Bethany was very confused.
column5: Her mother gave her ice cream to distract her.

column1: Jena had a new boyfriend.
column2: Her father didn't like the young man.
column3: He warned the boy to stop seeing his daughter.
column4: Jenna's boyfriend stopped talking to her.
column5: Jena was distraught.

column1: Tia was lost in the woods.
column2: She had been hiking with her family, but they were separated.
column3: Tia tried to remain calm.
column4: SHe stayed put and waited for her family to find her.
column5: Thankfully, they found her just an hour later!

column1: AJ broke his glasses.
column2: They were shattered all over the ground.
column3: He decided to buy a new pair.
column4: He went to the doctor.
column5: He picked out his favorite pair.

column1: Gidget liked to watch birds.
column2: She wanted to get a set of binoculars for bird watching.
column3: On her birthday, Gidget's Dad got her a nice set of binoculars.
column4: Gidget could now watch little birds who roosted in high trees.
column5: Gidget quickly became very knowledgeable about bird habitats.

column1: Jessica enjoyed Mcdonald's breakfast food.
column2: She had a hard time making it there on time though.
column3: Her friend told her that the breakfast menu was available all day.
column4: Jessica did not believe her at all.
column5: She realized that it was true the next time she went.

column1: When Kelly was getting ready for school she was pumped.
column2: She had a brand new outfit to show her friends.
column3: When she got to school everyone loved the outfit.
column4: Yet to her dismay, Katie was wearing the same thing.
column5: Kelly was horrified and disgusted.

column1: Mariana was stranded on an island.
column2: She had long exhausted her supplies.
column3: She decided to find some food.
column4: She saw some weird plants and ate them.
column5: She got sick but survived the day.

column1: Laby won a member of the month award on a forum.
column2: She was so happy she jumped up to go tell her husband.
column3: She ran and hit her head on the door.
column4: Lady fell down and got a big bruise on her forehead.
column5: Laby regretted having won the award.

column1: Gina lived in Syria.
column2: When the rebels began to take over, her family fled to Turkey.
column3: Once in Turkey, Gina's family applied for asylum in the United States.
column4: The application process took two years.
column5: Finally they were approved and now live in New York.

column1: I always wanted to learn karate.
column2: We spent a lot of time looking at different schools.
column3: My parents left the decision up to me.
column4: I chose the school that I liked the most.
column5: I have my first karate class on Thursday night.
